Cannoli Cheesecake Bars

Jump to Recipe

Welcome to the delightful world of Cannoli Cheesecake Bars—a dessert that beautifully marries the rich, creamy textures of traditional cheesecake with the iconic flavors of Italian cannoli. If you’ve ever found yourself torn between the indulgence of a decadent cheesecake and the crispy, sweet allure of cannoli, this recipe is your answer. With a buttery graham cracker crust, a luscious filling made from creamy ricotta and mascarpone cheeses, and a sprinkle of mini chocolate chips, these bars are sure to be a hit at any gathering. Whether you’re looking to impress guests at a dinner party, celebrate a special occasion, or simply satisfy your sweet tooth, these Cannoli Cheesecake Bars are the perfect blend of convenience and elegance. Plus, they are easy to make and can be prepared in advance, allowing you to enjoy more time with your loved ones. Get ready to dive into a dessert that is not only delicious but also visually stunning—let’s get started on creating this irresistible treat!

Ingredients

graham cracker crumbs

For a gluten-free option, use crushed gluten-free cookies or almond flour mixed with a bit of sugar. To enhance the flavor, consider adding a teaspoon of cinnamon or nutmeg to the crumbs before mixing with butter.

granulated sugar

You can substitute granulated sugar with coconut sugar or a sugar alternative like Stevia for a lower-calorie option. To enhance the flavor, you can also add a pinch of salt to balance the sweetness.

unsalted butter

If you need a dairy-free option, use coconut oil or vegan butter instead. Make sure to melt it before mixing it with the graham cracker crumbs for better incorporation.

ricotta cheese

If ricotta is not available, you can substitute it with cottage cheese (blended until smooth) or cream cheese for a richer flavor. For a lighter version, consider using part-skim ricotta.

mascarpone cheese

If you can’t find mascarpone, you can use cream cheese softened to room temperature, mixed with a little heavy cream to mimic the texture. Alternatively, blended silken tofu can be used for a dairy-free version.

eggs

For a vegan alternative, replace each egg with 1/4 cup of unsweetened applesauce or a flax egg (1 tablespoon ground flaxseed mixed with 2.5 tablespoons water, let sit until thickened). This will help bind the ingredients.

vanilla extract

To amplify the vanilla flavor, consider using vanilla bean paste or scraping the seeds from a vanilla pod instead. For a different twist, try adding almond extract for a unique flavor profile.

mini chocolate chips

You can substitute with dark chocolate chips or white chocolate chips depending on your preference. For a healthier option, use carob chips or chopped nuts for added texture.

powdered sugar

For dusting, you can use cocoa powder or a mixture of powdered sugar and cinnamon for a flavorful twist. If you're looking for a sugar-free option, powdered erythritol can be used instead.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Set your oven to 325°F (160°C) to ensure it's ready for baking. Proper preheating is crucial for even cooking.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Crust

    In a medium bowl, combine 1 ½ cups of graham cracker crumbs, ⅓ cup of granulated sugar, and ½ cup of melted unsalted butter. Mix until all crumbs are evenly coated with butter. This will create a flavorful and crispy crust.

  • Step 3: Press the Crust into the Baking Dish

    Grease a 9x9 inch baking dish with non-stick spray or butter. Press the graham cracker mixture firmly into the bottom of the dish using the back of a measuring cup or your fingers. This will help it hold together when sliced.

  • Step 4: Prepare the Cheesecake Filling

    In a large bowl, combine 15 oz of ricotta cheese, 8 oz of mascarpone cheese, 2 eggs, and 1 tsp of vanilla extract. Mix with a hand mixer or whisk until smooth and creamy. This mixture is key for your cannoli cheesecake flavor.

  • Step 5: Incorporate Chocolate Chips

    Gently fold in ½ cup of mini chocolate chips into the cheese mixture. Be careful not to overmix, as you want to keep the chips evenly distributed without breaking them.

  • Step 6: Pour and Spread the Filling

    Pour the cheesecake filling over the prepared crust and spread it evenly with a spatula. This ensures that every bite is equally delicious.

  • Step 7: Bake the Cheesecake Bars

    Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 35-40 minutes. The bars are done when the edges are set, and the center is slightly jiggly. They will firm up as they cool.

  • Step 8: Cool and Refrigerate

    Once baked, remove from the oven and let cool at room temperature for about 30 minutes. Then, refrigerate for at least 2 hours (or overnight) to set completely. Chilling enhances the flavor and texture.

  • Step 9: Serve and Enjoy

    Before serving, dust the top with powdered sugar for a beautiful presentation. Slice into bars and enjoy your delicious cannoli cheesecake bars!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I measure ingredients accurately?

Use dry measuring cups for solids (like flour or sugar) and liquid measuring cups for liquids. Level off dry ingredients with a knife for accuracy.

What is the best way to crush graham crackers for the crust?

Place the graham crackers in a zip-top bag and crush them with a rolling pin or a heavy object until they are fine crumbs.

Why is my cheesecake mixture lumpy?

Make sure to mix your cheeses well and at room temperature. Cold ingredients can cause lumps, so let them sit out for about 30 minutes before mixing.

How can I tell when my cheesecake bars are done baking?

The edges should be set and lightly golden, while the center will still have a slight jiggle. It will firm up as it cools.

What if I don’t have mini chocolate chips?

You can chop regular chocolate bars into small pieces or use other mix-ins like chopped nuts or dried fruit.

How do I safely handle hot pans in the oven?

Always use oven mitts when handling hot pans. Make sure they are dry to prevent burns, and never leave hot pans unattended on the stovetop or counter.

How long do the cheesecake bars need to cool before slicing?

Let the bars cool at room temperature for about 30 minutes, then refrigerate for at least 2 hours to set fully.

Can I use a different type of pan?

Yes, you can use an 8x8 inch or a 9x13 inch pan, but you may need to adjust the baking time slightly depending on the depth of the mixture.

What is the purpose of dusting with powdered sugar?

Powdered sugar adds a touch of sweetness and a nice decorative finish to the bars, making them visually appealing.

What should I do if I burn my dessert?

If it's only slightly burnt on the edges, you can trim off the burnt parts. If it's severely burnt, it’s best to start over. Remember, everyone makes mistakes!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For those with dietary restrictions, consider using gluten-free graham cracker crumbs to make the crust suitable for gluten-intolerant guests. To lower the sugar content, you can substitute granulated sugar with a sugar alternative like erythritol or stevia. For a dairy-free version, look for vegan cream cheese alternatives and use a dairy-free butter substitute in the crust. Always ensure that any substitutes maintain the structural integrity and flavor profile of the dessert.

Pairings

These Cannoli Cheesecake Bars pair beautifully with a robust coffee, such as an espresso or cappuccino, which complements the richness of the cheesecake. For a more festive option, consider serving with a dessert wine like Vin Santo or a sweet Marsala wine that enhances the flavors of the ricotta and mascarpone. Additionally, a light, fruity red wine like Lambrusco can also be a delightful pairing.

Serving Suggestions

Serve these bars chilled for the best texture and flavor, perhaps on a beautiful dessert platter. Garnish with a sprinkle of mini chocolate chips or a swirl of chocolate syrup for added visual appeal. For an elegant touch, consider adding a few fresh berries on the side, such as raspberries or strawberries, which will provide a tart contrast to the sweet bars. For a more playful presentation, you can serve them on individual dessert plates dusted with powdered sugar and a sprig of mint.

#

Cannoli Cheesecake Bars

55 min
$12.5
350 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 12

Allergens:

DairyGlutenEggs

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

Italian

Course:

Dessert

Tags:

DessertItalianEasy

Description

A delightful twist on classic cheesecake, these Cannoli Cheesecake Bars combine creamy ricotta and mascarpone with chocolate chips, wrapped in a sweet crust.

Ingredients

  • graham cracker crumbs: 1 ½ cups
  • granulated sugar: ⅓ cup
  • unsalted butter: ½ cup, melted
  • ricotta cheese: 15 oz
  • mascarpone cheese: 8 oz
  • eggs: 2
  • vanilla extract: 1 tsp
  • mini chocolate chips: ½ cup
  • powdered sugar: for dusting

Date Created:

11/17/2024
